institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Industry-led youth customized training business operation rules/Article 3 (Definition of terms)
contents: Article 3 (Definition of Terms) The definitions of terms used in this rule are as follows: 1. Industry-led youth customized training (hereinafter referred to as *industry-led training) refers to industry-specific cooperatives/organizations and industry-type joint training centers. This means that the entire process, from training demand survey to training course design and training implementation, is customized to reflect the needs of industries and companies. 2. Industry-specific cooperatives and organizations (hereinafter referred to as *cooperatives and organizations) are entities that carry out business together with industrial joint training centers to perform roles such as surveying training demands, designing training courses that reflect industry demands, and providing training consulting. Refers to an organization selected by the industry-specific human resources development deliberation committee in accordance with Article 38 of the “National Human Resources Development Consortium Operation Regulations (hereinafter referred to as *Operation Regulations)”. 3. An industrial joint training center (hereinafter referred to as *joint training center) is a facility that provides education and training based on the results of a training demand survey conducted by cooperatives and organizations in accordance with Article 5, Paragraph 2, Item 5 of the Operation Regulations, Article 38 of the Operation Regulations. Refers to an institution selected by the industry-specific human resource development review committee in accordance with Article 4. Industry-led training project group (hereinafter referred to as *project group) refers to a joint training center with an association or organization that carries out an industry-led training project. 5. Demand survey by industry (hereinafter referred to as *demand survey) refers to a quantitative and qualitative survey conducted by cooperatives and organizations on the demand for manpower and education and training in the industry to design training courses. 6. Regular training course refers to a training course that the joint training center opens in addition to the training course set in the annual training plan according to the results of the demand survey of cooperatives and groups. 7. Partner training institution refers to an institution that has been certified as a training institution by the Korea University of Technology and Education (Vocational Competency Review and Assessment Service) in accordance with Article 53 of the Worker Vocational Competency Development Act, and provides vocational training to contracting companies in accordance with Article 18 (1). Refers to an institution selected by the Joint Training Center for the purpose of providing and approved by the Human Resources Development Service of Korea (hereinafter referred to as *the Corporation). Refers to a company that has signed an agreement to cooperate with a joint training center in terms of conducting training and recruiting trainees, etc., 9. Support funds are provided by the Chairman of the Corporation (hereinafter referred to as *Chairman) to cooperatives and organizations in accordance with Article 19 of the Operational Regulations. and operating costs (including labor costs), training facility and equipment costs, and program development costs provided to the joint training center. 10. Contribution refers to the amount that the project group must pay in accordance with Article 19, Paragraph 1, Item 3 and Annex Table 5 of the Operation Regulations in order to receive support funds. 11. Training cost refers to training costs, meal expenses, etc. directly incurred in operating the training course. This refers to costs such as accommodation, training allowance, and wages. 12. Standard unit price refers to the standard unit price of training costs for each occupation according to Annex Table 2 of the 「Employer Vocational Competency Development and Training Support Regulations」 (hereinafter referred to as *Employer Support Regulations). 13. Unit period refers to the minimum unit period for paying training costs, and is divided into periods of one month from the training start date.
